content.description: A short but steeper face route between The Fire Swamp and Princess Buttercup. Follow the blunt, curving arete up a line of bolts. Seemingly more difficult than the rating suggests.
content.location: Listed as route #6 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description: The off-width crack right of Planet of the Apes. Short route.
content.protection: Medium to large gear--a number 4 camalot up high is nice. No anchor. Can use anchors of As You Wish I would guess.
content.location: Listed as route #3 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description: A nice layback and crack climb up the obvious crack between 99 Red Balloons and Once Were Warriors. Use anchors of either neighboring climb or gear anchor.
content.protection: Big gear to bolted anchors of one of the neighboring climbs.
content.location: Listed as route #9 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description:
R.O.U.S. is a clean face route on really good rock with a bit of thin face climbing before a small roof move near the top.  Make some easy scrambling moves up six feet to a comfy stance, solid hand jam and the first bolt. Face climb on small holds through the crux of the route between bolts 2 and 3 using small pockets and edges past a couple more bolts up to a small ledge and small roof. It is here, under the roof, that R.O.U.S.es may be hiding. Move quickly!  The well-protected mini-roof move is another crux to a super large ledge and the anchor.  

  Rodents Of Unusual Size (ROUS) reside in the Fire Swamp and attacked Princess Buttercup and her companion Westley when they bravely entered the Fire Swamp. If you're not familiar with R.O.U.S.es watch a short segment from the movie The Princess Bride. At about 6:13 minutes into the segment the R.O.U.S.es appear.  

youtube.com/watch?v=jKxo5y8…
content.protection: A generously protected route that would make for a good first sport lead. 6 bolts to a two-bolt anchor equipped with carabiners.
content.location: This route ascends the clean face to the right of Princess Buttercup.

climbs.name: Princess Buttercup
climbs.fa: Scott Fitzgibbon, Luke Laeser, Theo Takeda, Rick Bradshaw, Carlo Torres and Walt Wehner, 1/98

content.description: A pocketed, slabby route that makes for a good beginner sport lead.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor with steel lowering biners.
content.location: Listed as route #7 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description: The hardest route at Gallows Edge. Stick-clip the high first bolt and work your way through short, steep and powerful moves through a series of two-finger pockets near the arete to a huge jug below the very high first bolt. Using the arete on the right apparently makes it a bit easier (5.11-ish) but seems natural and arguably more fun. A few more steep moves lead to the second bolt before the angle backs off past the third bolt to the anchors for The Fire Swamp.
content.protection: 3 bolts to shared anchors with The Fire Swamp. The first bolt is way up there and the crux moves come before it so using a stick clip is highly recommended.
content.location: Listed as route #4 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

climbs.name: Planet of the Apes
climbs.fa: Scott Fitzgibbon, Luke Laeser, Theo Takeda, Rick Bradshaw, Carlo Torres and Walt Wehner, 1/98

content.description: The left-most bolted route at the Gallows Edge main wall. Easy climbing down low to a fun, challenging and airy arete finish.  One anchor bolt was replaced in April 2007.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor with carabiners.
content.location: The left-most bolted route at the Gallows Edge main wall. Listed as #2 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

climbs.name: Once Were Warriors
climbs.fa: Scott Fitzgibbon, Luke Laeser, Theo Takeda, Rick Bradshaw, Carlo Torres and Walt Wehner, 1/98

content.description: Easy climbing then more fun face climbing to the steep finish on big holds.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a chain anchor with carabiners. Please don't steal the carabiners and enjoy the safety and convenience.
content.location: Listed as route #10 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description: A small overhang at the bottom leads to thin face climbing to a nice ledge. Take a break at the ledge and then tackle the steep finish.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a two bolt anchor with carabiners. Please enjoy the safety and convenience of the fixed carabiners and leave them for others to use and enjoy too.
content.location: The next-to-right-most bolted route on the Gallows Edge main wall. Listed at route #11 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

climbs.name: The Giant Killer
climbs.fa: Various local lads in the early 1990s including Wehner, Takeda, Green, Lyons, Laesar, Frostensen

content.description: The slabby, short face at the far right end of the main wall. The first ten feet are steep and then the angle backs off for the remaining 20 feet. Mostly soloed for years but after comments from folks in the FA party about it possibly getting bolted to add another beginner sport lead to an area that's known for its beginner sport routes, bolts were added in summer 2008.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two-bolt anchor with clips.
content.location: The slabby, short face at the far right end of the main wall.  Listed as route #12 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

climbs.name: Gallows' Girdle
climbs.fa: First recorded ascent: Erik Hanschen, Kayley You Mak; October 1, 2019.

content.description: Start at Fezzik (Andre the Giant) and head left until you're at the chains of the Butler route. Choose your own adventure style climbing; I stayed fairly high (2/3rd to most anchors) and leap frogged a couple draws to manage drag. I found the downclimb from high on "Prince Humperdink" to midway up "As You Wish" to be a bit awkward, pretty chossy, and unprotected. Maybe a larger cam would protect here.
content.protection: Bolts, bring alpine draws to manage drag.
content.location: Far right side of the Main Wall at Gallows Edge.

climbs.name: The Fire Swamp
climbs.fa: Various local lads in the early 1990s including Wehner, Takeda, Green, Lyons, Laesar, Frostensen

content.description: One of the better routes at Gallows. Thin moves down low lead to very nice, bigger pockets higher up.  Good stone.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor with carabiners. For the safety and convenience of everyone, please don't steal the carabiners!
content.location: Listed as route #5 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description: The crux is between the ledge where the anchors are located and above the big boulder/ledge. Using only the pockets without the arete makes it harder than 5.9.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two bolt anchor, including lowering biners. Don't steal these.
content.location: To the right of "Giant Killer, The", thereby the name "Fezzik (Andre the Giant)".

content.description: The left-most route at Gallows. A good, low-angle crack line that makes for a nice beginner trad lead as it protects very well.
content.protection: Small to medium gear to two-bolt anchor.
content.location: Left-most route at Gallows Edge. Listed as route 1 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description: This is a steep face route with some shark-mouthed pockets. The crux is moving beyond the 2nd bolt. Gain a ledge below the third bolt. A forth bolt protects the face to the left of the arete with friendly ledges to the anchors. There is an easier variation by climbing further left of the bolt line and a harder variation just right of the bolt line.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt chained anchor with lowering biners. I suspect the anchors for this route would serve useful for those climbing the unknown crack route to the left of this line.
content.location: This route is located directly to the right of the Unknown Crack Route or 10 feet right of Planet of the Apes. It starts on the upper talus table by scrambling up the blocks right of Planet of the Apes.

content.description: The first bolted route right of the large chimney near the middle of the main wall. Fun face climbing with a steep finish on jugs. Using the arete on the left keeps the climb at 5.8.  More challenging is not using the arete and making the route 5.9ish.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor with carabiners. For the safety and convenience of everyone, please leave the carabiners in place and enjoy using them!
content.location: Listed as route #8 on the Gallows Edge Main Wall photo topo.

content.description:
Pros:  short, easy, well-protected, don't need expensive cams--in these respects a good beginning lead. 

  Cons:  short.
content.protection: Can be led with only nuts, slings, and tricams without getting run out.  No anchors (yet).
content.location:
Slab just right of As You Wish, just left of Prince Humperdink. 

  Walk off the top or shimmy down the cave/chimney.

content.description:
The Main Wall at Gallows Edge has the largest concentration of routes at Gallows. 8 bolted routes and a few crack lines are found here. 

  Carlo Torres, Jon Butler, Lucas Laeser, and Mike Lyons discovered this wall, and solo'd most of the 1st ascents.
